text:
<@UD53A9UUR> you're answer made me curious, one follow-up question to this:
How do you preview your local changes on templates and stuff when not using the local-hubl-server? Are you using the preview in HubSpot Design Tools for previewing your local changes?
yes.  the preview page should dynamically reload with changes.  there are a few people here who are injected their styles/scripts with a gulp build if you are feeling adventurous

Right, well thanks for the info!
I tried to run a local preview with local hubl server - even before pushing to HubSpot itself. The problem here was, that referencing assets (img, js, css) in the template itself differs when working with local hubl server or HubSpot itself.
I already use gulp for managing assets (img optimizing, sass->css) before pushing the built assets to HubSpot. So with your info, I will now extend the gulp watch tasks to directly push to our staging HubSpot account :tada:
Anyway, thanks again for your feedback! :thumbsup:

Happy New Years everyone! 

We just released version 1.0.4 of the CMS CLI, which includes a few important updates:

1. Support for interacting with the File Manager using a new `filemanager` sub-command. NOTE: this only works when using API key authentication at this time, and only works with the `upload` command (`hs filemanager upload [src] [dest]`).
Ex: `hs filemanager upload project/files cool-files` will create a "cool-files" directory in the File Manager with all included files. 
2. There is now am optional `--disable-initial` option for the `watch` command which will skip the initial upload of all files within the directory you specify to watch.
3. A new `hs init` command which prompts a guided experience for setting up authentication for the first time (creating a `HubSpot.config.yml` file with an entry for a portal specified)

Run `npm install -g @HubSpot/cms-cli` to get access to these features. As always, please send any feedback along!
wooooooooo any idea when the oAuth authentication will be supported?
if you are using only oauth you might as well just upload it via HubSpot
we’ve had some mass uploads that make uploading via HubSpot pretty tedious. will look into maybe doing local with API auth.
Not sure. We need to adjust the OAuth flow to add support for multiple scopes. You can subscribe to <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/issues/26> if you want to know when we make progress.
